The gSoap Library Analyzer 2™ utility provides a basic eventing process to assist in testing.
If you already have an open GUI session from the same IP address running within the same browser instance, the gSoap Library Analyzer 2™ will use the same session cookies for authentication as the original instance.
However, registering for events from the gSoap Library Analyzer 2™ will not cause conflicts because a new event queue with a unique PID is created for each client that successfully subscribes for events.
If a session key is automatically set when you load the gSoap Library Analyzer 2™ page, then there is already a session cookie resident in the browser instance. In order to preserve the original session cookie when the gSoap Library Analyzer 2™ signs out, the user will be prompted for a decision about whether to delete the cookie or leave it intact.
Description After a successful sign in, you may turn on events by clicking the start events button. This will invoke a 'subscribeForEvents' soap call, and if it succeeds the eventing icon will turn green and a continuous polling loop will begin to gather events.
Each time an event is retrieved, the green eventing icon will turn blue briefly to indicate an event has arrived. The event manager will store a maximum of 100 events, after which it will drop the oldest event from its collection as each new event arrives.
Eventing Options
Option or Button Description
Capture Heartbeats Check this checkbox to add heartbeat events to the collection. Uncheck this checkbox to ignore heartbeat events.
Note: Heartbeats can be helpful for verifying that the eventing service is running, especially when there is no other activtiy that would cause an event to be generated.
show events Click this button to display the collection of events in the results window in descending order (last received events appear first).
reset events Click this button to clear the event collection. This does not stop eventing.
stop events Click this button to completely stop the event polling process and unsubscribe. You do not have to do this before signing out because it will happen automatically during the sign out process.
